title: get eth_getLogs error  "code": -32000,  "message": "context canceled"
body:
Hello, I have a problem in the geth private chain.
Postman Request the following:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22950089/53158235-1ada7300-35fe-11e9-86fd-83be650a6401.png)

How should I solve this problem?
hi @1099223026 you need pasted geth version and specified the block correctly.

Thank you for your reply.

Geth version 1.9.0 - unstable

Backup the previous private chain block data to other directories, rebuild the private chain on the local virtual machine and start mining. Everything is normal, and the eth_getLogs method can be accessed, as shown in the figure:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22950089/53310392-a64a5180-38e7-11e9-9425-a45294b4d3fc.png)

However, as long as I put the previous block data into the private chain data directory of the local virtual machine, the following figure will appear:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22950089/53310444-eb6e8380-38e7-11e9-9e65-0897e556927a.png)

I suspect it's the books themselves.
Because the log file is too large, this is the truncated part of the log:
